course.subject: COMP
course.name: Computer and Communication Networks
course.description: Principles of computer network architectures and communication protocols; the OSI reference model; switching and multiplexing techniques; data link, network, transport and application layers; LAN and medium access protocols; network programming.
course.prerequisites: COMP 2611 OR [(ELEC 2300 OR ELEC 2350) AND (COMP 2011 OR COMP 2012H)]
course.exclusions: COMP 5621, ELEC 3120, ISOM 3180

reviews.author: Andrio
reviews.comment_content:
You learn how the internet works and how computers communicate with each other. The course covers the five Internet layer stack and teaches from the top to bottom (except the lowest one physical layer). There might be some extra contents such as wireless networking, security, etc. and you might also learn something about hacking.
About 90% concepts and 10% probabilities. Some stuff from COMP3711, 3511, and MATH2411 are also there. Four written assignments and one programming project. Then midterm and final.
Programming project was quite challenging. Basically you need to make a multi-threaded server-client using java from scratch (no skeleton).
reviews.comment_teaching: Teachings are good. The instructor actively asks for feedback during the lectures. The TA is also easily approachable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Written assignments (4): 20%
Programming assignment: 15%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 40%
Midterm exam format is strange as it feels like doing homework.
Finals are okay, some theories, some calculations, and some probabilities.
reviews.comment_workload:
Written assignments are usually theories, so you can look at the textbook or google it. Sometimes there are questions that need calculations so it might take time. Rarely probability questions come out. These ones are hard and take most of the time.
Programming assignment: you should really start early especially if you don't know java well. In my opinion, the hard part is more on the multi-threading than networking.

reviews.author: CS水泡
reviews.comment_content:
Network has 5 layers, everything from application to the physical wires. If you have taken ELEC1200, this is very similar.

Nothing new, just brings you to appreciate how the internet is basically held together by duct tape and still functions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures are fine, but the TA did not care whether we live or die.

There are a total of 4 labs which is not enough to finish the programming assignment, nor does it relate to the content taught in class. The programming assignment is basically to teach yourself barebone socket programming in C.

Teaching in class is useful as professor reveals a lot on what he will put in the exams. I asked him to go faster when he tried to teach distance vector for the second time and he insisted that was important.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 Written Assignments (20% total)
1 Programming Assignment (15%)
Midterm (25%)
Final (40%)

Mean (77% overall) is anywhere from C to B-, 10% above mean is A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload outside of the exams, since the written and programming assignments are very similar to previous years.

Attend the class if you want good grades. You can even ask the professor how to do the written assignment question. He won't dodge your question since the assignments were exclusively handled by the TA.

reviews.author: stereo
reviews.comment_content:
Internet Comm 有5個layer，成個course就係教唔同hosts (router, endpoint, DNS etc.) 之間點樣係呢5個layer溝通 (protocol)

所以，呢個course 你會學到好多protocol 同埋hosts 之間既 comm policy
Application, Transport, Network, Link Layer
Physical layer冇notes，所以得4個chapter
reviews.comment_teaching: 好少上堂💩  通常都同TA email多，TA 幾盡責，如果佢地改分可以快少少就更好
reviews.comment_grading:
總分median，below mean，B-，AB range加埋有一半，即係C range佔另外一半 lol

功課有google 就做到
Midterm below mean 幾分
Final冇出分，直接出grade :D

Project 要寫一個HTTP server，語言不拘 (不過lab code 用C，既然可以參考當然跟住用linux C...)
mean 90/120
reviews.comment_workload:
一課百幾版lecture notes + chapter summary瘋狂背完入去考，不過呢科得4課，內容比3511少，worload主要來自deadline fighter 背書

project 其中兩個計分項 (chunked encoding & gzip compression) 好似冇教過...? 靠google 做到chunked, gzip索性冇做
而且deadline 係exam period 中間，同時間溫書+做proj

reviews.author: kverma
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly theoretical. Some concepts watered down for better understanding. Practical applications not apparent so it doesn't seem that interesting.

Syllabus
Principles of computer network architectures and communication protocols

The OSI reference model

Switching and multiplexing techniques

Data link, network, transport and application layers

LAN and medium access protocols

Network programming
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof explains content well. She makes an effort to go deep yet keep stuff digestible for students. She also discusses relevant research if time allows, which  makes things interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Our batch had 22 people so grading wasn't that harsh.
Midterm Exam,  30%
Final Exam,  35%
Homework,  21%
Project,  14%

88.5 overall -> A
reviews.comment_workload:
Light. 3 assignments, one project,
Assignments are theory based - kinda like those in 3511 os - each takes 1-2 hrs
Project is making a mail server using Java. Skeleton code is given so the task takes 5 hours max.
Course also has midterm and final
Final is not cumulative - consists of content covered after midterm.
Both exams aren't crazy difficult but reading the textbook for concepts u don't understand is advised.

reviews.author: JS
reviews.comment_content:
Layers: app, trans, network/internet, link
4621 dicussed all layers, which involves simple calculcation. Student who get C+ in MATH1014 should find no difficuties in understanding the logic.

algorithm: dijkstra, bellman ford
These are the algorithm used in discussing routing algorithms, which are easy as they are just steps to follow. No variety.

Most of the content is concrete and you just have to memorise them. This course mainly discussed on HOW the internet protocol is enforced rather than WHY.

But the content is rather insufficient in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kai is acceptable. The pace is slow but not in depth.
The tutorial is less then enough. TAs are not bad and in fact they are good at teaching concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since most of the students got 7X and higher, the A range is estimable around 95~100 as I get very close to this score and got a B+.
So if you are not really familiar with networking or bad at it, the grade will not be proportional to your effort you paid for this course.
In short, not good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
4~5(I forgot)HW. 1Ass. 1MT. 1Final.

HWs are mix of 70% SQ and 30% LQ.
PJ requires you to write an HTTP Server to serve HTML, images, pdfs, pptxs, css files. 20% bonus for gzip and chunk transfer. You can choose any language you like. I chose Java. Btw, the assignment requires you not to use 3rd party lib, just ordinary socket programming and construct the response message on your own.

MT and Final are similar to HW. Make sure you do all the HW.

Tutorials are about the assignment. They help.

Most of the student got ~80.

reviews.author: namreh
reviews.comment_content:
As there is no reviews for the prof, here is a short summary.

This is COMP5621/CSIT5610 but with bad grading, as the course is very competitive.
All lectures are very knowledge-based. There's no hands-on exercise in the course.

Content
- Applicaiton Layer
- Transport Layer
- Network Layer
- Data Link Layer
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is passionate about teaching, but his teaching is very fast-paced. He wants to squeeze as much content as possible in the course.

He expects us to be good at Math. Have fun with all the derive formula in your assignments and exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
He teaches the simplest example in lectures, and gives incredibly difficult/tricky questions for you in exams.

If you are hard-working students who want to study harder for a better grade, unfortunately there is no exercises for you to practice.

Exams questions are very similar to COMP5621/CSIT5610. If you have source, A range is pretty much guaranteed. If not, then good luck.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is low.
2 written assignments, 1 programming assignment and 2 exams.

Some questions in the written assignments are designed by the prof himself and you probably cannot find the answers online.

Programming assignment is easy as long as you are willing to spend time doing it.
